thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.name: Automated Vulnerability Scanning
thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.description: Third-party software components should be continuously scanned for known vulnerabilities

testResults.details: 93.4% scanning coverage across 1845 third-party components with daily frequency
456 vulnerabilities detected across npm, NuGet, Python, and container ecosystems
23 critical vulnerabilities identified with 45 new vulnerabilities in latest scan

thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.remediation: Automated vulnerability scanning comprehensively implemented with effective multi-ecosystem coverage

thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.name: Vulnerability Intelligence Integration
thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.description: Vulnerability monitoring should integrate multiple intelligence sources for comprehensive threat awareness

testResults.details: Multiple intelligence sources with real-time synchronization and 100% NVD coverage
EPSS scores for 389 vulnerabilities with active exploit detection for 12 vulnerabilities
Sub-5-minute alert latency with multi-channel notification integration

thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.remediation: Vulnerability intelligence comprehensively integrated with advanced enrichment and real-time alerting

thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.name: Contractual Notification Requirements
thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.description: Vendor contracts should include security vulnerability notification requirements and SLAs

testResults.test: Vendor contract security clause coverage assessment
testResults.details: 85.3% of vendor contracts include security notification requirements
79.3% critical vulnerability notification compliance with average 18.5-hour response
83.4% overall notification compliance with systematic performance tracking

thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.remediation: Contractual notification requirements well-established with strong vendor compliance monitoring

thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.name: Incomplete Vulnerability Remediation Tracking
thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.description: Vulnerability remediation lacks comprehensive tracking and SLA enforcement

testResults.details: 68.4% tracking coverage with 144 untracked vulnerabilities
74.7% overall SLA compliance with 67.4% critical vulnerability compliance
80 overdue vulnerabilities with average 12.3-day critical remediation time

thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.remediation: HIGH PRIORITY: 1) Implement comprehensive vulnerability remediation tracking for all 456 identified vulnerabilities, 2) Establish automated remediation workflows for low-risk vulnerabilities, 3) Improve critical vulnerability remediation to meet 7-day SLA target, 4) Address remediation bottlenecks through resource allocation and process optimization, 5) Implement automated testing and validation for vulnerability patches, 6) Establish escalation procedures for overdue critical vulnerabilities

thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.name: Limited Vendor Security Communication
thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.description: Vendor security communication lacks standardization and proactive engagement

testResults.details: 52.9% communication channel coverage with 16 missing vendor connections

testResults.test: Security advisory receival and response assessment
testResults.details: 61.8% vendor advisory coverage with 3.2-day average acknowledgment time

testResults.test: Vendor security capability and maturity evaluation
testResults.details: 55.9% vendor security program coverage with basic maturity assessment

thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.remediation: MEDIUM PRIORITY: 1) Establish security communication channels with all 34 vendors including emergency contact procedures, 2) Implement standardized vendor security advisory receival process with automated acknowledgment, 3) Conduct comprehensive vendor security capability assessments including incident response testing, 4) Establish vendor security scorecard with regular maturity assessments, 5) Implement proactive vendor security engagement program with regular security reviews, 6) Deploy vendor risk monitoring with continuous security posture assessment

thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.name: Inadequate Threat Intelligence Integration
thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.description: Threat intelligence lacks integration with vulnerability management for contextual risk assessment

testResults.details: 50% threat intelligence source integration with limited contextual enrichment
234 exposed components identified with limited threat actor targeting analysis

testResults.test: Threat landscape awareness and predictive capabilities
testResults.details: Basic industry threat awareness with no predictive threat modeling

thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.remediation: MEDIUM PRIORITY: 1) Integrate remaining 4 threat intelligence sources with automated enrichment capabilities, 2) Implement contextual risk scoring combining vulnerability data with threat intelligence, 3) Deploy attack surface monitoring with threat actor targeting analysis, 4) Establish dark web monitoring for leaked credentials and exploit kit tracking, 5) Implement predictive threat modeling for supply chain risk assessment, 6) Develop industry-specific threat landscape monitoring and analysis

thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.name: Missing End-of-Life and Deprecation Tracking
thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.description: Third-party software end-of-life and deprecation status lacks systematic tracking and planning

testResults.details: 24.7% tracking coverage with 1389 untracked components
47 deprecated/EOL components identified with 3 ending support within 30 days
25.5% migration plan coverage with limited alternative component identification

thirdPartySoftwareVulnerabilityMonitorin.remediation: LOW PRIORITY: 1) Implement automated end-of-life tracking for all 1845 third-party components with vendor lifecycle monitoring, 2) Establish deprecation status dashboard with automated alerts for approaching end-of-life dates, 3) Develop migration planning framework with alternative component identification and evaluation, 4) Implement automated migration timeline tracking with milestone management, 5) Create vendor lifecycle management process with proactive renewal and replacement planning, 6) Deploy component lifecycle analytics with predictive replacement recommendations

Container image scanning: Trivy, Twistlock, Azure Container Registry vulnerability assessment
Package manager integration: npm audit, pip-audit, NuGet vulnerability checking
CI/CD pipeline integration: Automated vulnerability scanning in build and deployment processes
Continuous monitoring: Real-time vulnerability detection and alerting systems
vulnerabilityIntelligenceIntegration: National Vulnerability Database: NVD CVE feed integration and synchronization
GitHub Security Advisory Database: GHSA vulnerability intelligence integration
Vendor security advisories: Microsoft, npm, Python, Docker security advisory monitoring
Threat intelligence feeds: Commercial and open-source threat intelligence integration
EPSS scoring: Exploit Prediction Scoring System integration for prioritization
contractualNotificationTracking: Contract management systems: Vendor agreement tracking and security clause validation
Vendor communication platforms: Security notification receival and response tracking
SLA monitoring: Contractual notification timeline compliance measurement
Vendor performance dashboards: Security communication effectiveness tracking
Legal compliance tracking: Contractual obligation fulfillment monitoring
remediationTrackingAndManagement: Vulnerability management platforms: Centralized remediation tracking and workflow management
Ticketing systems: Issue tracking integration for vulnerability remediation tasks
Change management systems: Remediation deployment tracking and approval workflows
Testing frameworks: Automated patch testing and validation processes
Metrics and reporting: Remediation SLA compliance and performance analytics

iso27001.A.15.2.1: Monitoring and review of supplier services
